description: Whitewater Wipeout is an arcade-style surfing game controlled entirely with the Playdate's crank. The player uses the crank to control the surfer's direction and perform tricks when jumping from the top of the wave. Performing 360s before landing back on the wave will score the player points. If the player lands a trick incorrectly, falls from the bottom of the wave, or gets caught by the breaker coming from the right, the player loses one of their lives. After the player loses all 3 of their lives, the game is over and their score is logged in the high score table.

sample_screenshots.caption: The basically method of scoring is to jump from the top of the wave and preform a 360.
Failing to land correctly, falling off the bottom of the wave, or getting caught by the breaker will cause the player to lose a life.
The player's high score table.
Doing multiple 360s will give the player more points.
Scoring big with a triple.

title: Whitewater Wipeout

description:
Casual Birder is a 2D adventure game centred around photographing birds. The player finds themselves in the seaside town of Bird Town, a birdwatcher's paradise that is being terrorized by a group of thugs intent on maintaining their status as the best bird photographers. After an unfortunate run-in with the group on their way to deliver a package, the player is tasked with beating the thugs in the yearly bird photography competition, armed only with their phone's camera and whatever else they can find.

The player controls the game using the D-Pad to move around, the B button to look at their photos, and the A button to use items, interact with the environment, and talk to the towns various residence. The crank is used to cycle through the items in the player's inventory while they are walking around. When the player uses the camera, it appears over the screen showing what it's currently pointed at, and the player can move it around and use the crank to adjust the camera's focus.
title: Casual Birder

description: Sketch, Share, Solve is a nonogram puzzle game that allows the player to create and share puzzles. The game features a built-in editor that allows the player to create 15x10 nonogram puzzles which can then be exported as a JSON. The player can naturally import puzzles from other players and play through them, and the game includes 99 playable puzzles by the developer themselves. Completing a puzzle gives the player the ability to "remix" it, which imports the puzzle into the editor, allowing them to make their own changes to it.
title: Sketch, Share, Solve

description: Space Troubles is a simple shooter game where the player is piloting a spaceship through an asteroid belt and must shoot oncoming asteroids. The player does this by using the D-Pad to move their targeting reticule and pressing A to fire. Turning the crank allows the player to rapid fire shots. As the game goes on, the frequency of asteroids and the speed that they move towards the player increases. When an asteroid hits the player's ship they lose a heart, and once they lose all of them it's game over. There are 3 difficulty levels which affects how quickly the asteroids ramp up and how much score the player earns.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game features 3 difficulties.
The title screen of the game.
If you run out of health then it's game over.
The player must use their targeting reticule to shoot the asteroids.
The asteroids get closer and closer until they collide with the spaceship.

title: Space Troubles

description: Pulpmon is a miniature Pokémon-style monster collecting RPG. The game start's the same as most Pokémon games, with the player starting off in their home and leaving to meet a professor who will give them their first Pulpmon. The player can train and battle these Pulpmons against wild Pulpmons or other trainers, as well as use Pulp Nets to capture additional wild Pulpmons to fill out their PulpDex.

sample_screenshots.caption: Seems like the professor has gone missing.
A wild Stika appears.
Kiku has been captured.
Starting a new game.
The player also receives 5 Pulp Nets, which can be used to capture more Pulpmon.

title: Pulpmon

description: Between the Lines is a clone of the Light Cycle-style game Zatacka. The game can be played by up to 3 players on a single device using the crank, D-Pad, and A/B buttons to steer. Like other Light Cycle games the goal is to survive the longest without running into your trail or the trail of another player. The gimmick with this game is that the trail isn't constant but rather occasionally cuts out, leaving gaps that a skilled player can weave their way through.
title: Between the Lines

description: Crankin Presents Time Travel Adventure is a action puzzle game where the player controls Crankin, a robot who accidently oversleeps and must rush through each level to reach their date at the end. The player controls Crankin using the Playdate's crank, advancing him forwards or backwards depending on the direction the player moves it. Each level is filled with objects the Crankin will interact with on his way, as well as enemies which will force the player to start the level again if they're touched. The player must use the objects throughout each level to help them avoid the enemies. There are 50 levels in total.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level 5 brings in multiple enemies at once.
The butterflies are getting tricky by moving up and down.
Crankette is not impressed.
Close call.
Don't think there's much coming back from that one.

title: Crankin Presents Time Travel Adventure

description: A Joke That's Worth $ 0.99 is a simple but challenging crank controlled game where the player must use the crank to bounce a tiny person up to collect stars. With each star that is collected a line is read out from a joke, however if the person falls off the bottom of the screen then the joke ends and the player must start from the very beginning of the joke.

sample_screenshots.caption: The more collected, the more of the joke is heard.
The game starts immediately with the tiny person falling from the top of the screen.
The person must bouncy the tiny person up using the Playdate's crank to collect the stars.
Collecting each star will read out a line from a joke.
If the person falls, the player must start the joke from the very beginning.

title: A Joke That's Worth $ 0.99

description: Bloom is a narrative focused social sim where the player is put in the role of Midori, a young girl who drops out of college in order to fulfill their dream of running their own flower shop. At the start of the game the player has access to 4 plots on the roof where they can plant some flowers. The flowers grow in real time, even when the game is not running. Once a flower is fully grown, the player can dig it up, which instantly sells the flower for a profit. During the game the player will interact with various characters via text messages on her phone, such as her girlfriend Ai. The player has access to various other features via their phone, such as the ability to buy seeds, see the current and upcoming weather, and collect an assortment of gachapon trinkets. When the player has accumulated enough money, they can use it to pay their rent, which gives them access to additional plots and increases the amount of profit they make from each flower. The game also includes an Asteroids-style minigame called Starshooter Hoshiko, which they can play during their downtime.

sample_screenshots.caption: There are 30 different trinkets to collect.
The game's story plays out entirely through text messages.
In order to unlock more plots, the player has to pay their rent.
This app shows what the weather will be each day.
The phone includes an Asteroids-style minigame.

title: Bloom

description: Lost Your Marbles is a visual novel where the player takes the role of Prota, who's family dog Minty has run off. Prota must look around Pomegrante Village to find Minty and make it to the village's annual Festi-Ball before the end of the day. During the game, Prota will be asked various questions which the player can answer in different ways. In order to answer, the player must roll a marble and use it to hit a lightbulb that contains the answer by using the crank to tilt the level left or right.

sample_screenshots.caption: The levels get progressively more complicated as the game goes along.
Sounds like a fun time.
Bork!
Right in the trash.
Questions from now on are multiple choice.

title: Lost Your Marbles

description: Pick Pack Pup is a match 3 puzzle game where the player plays as Pup, who has started a new job at a fulfilment center. In the game, the player must match 3 or more items together to box them up and then ship them off to remove them from the playfield. Boxed items aren't removed automatically, so the player can make multiple matches and then ship them off all at once for bonus points. The game features multiple game modes that the player can play. Story mode, where the player follows Pup's story as they play through 30 levels with varying objectives. Infinity mode, an endless mode where the goal is to score as high as possible while the cost of penalties steadily increases. Chill mode, where the player can match without any penalties or end and see how many matches they can make at once. Danger Zone, where the player must clear bombs before they explode. And finally Time Attack, where the player has 2 minutes to score as many points as possible.

sample_screenshots.caption: Matching 3 or more of the same items will pack them into a box.
Selecting a packed box will ship it off.
Pushing down or turning the crank will scroll through a series of comic panels.
If the player fails a level they have to try again.
Later levels add a repeating timer which remove all the items on the bottom row and deduct their value from the player's score.

title: Pick Pack Pup

description: Ribbit Rabbit! is a puzzle game where the player controls the titular ribbit rabbit, a rabbit crossed with a frog. The goal of the game is to collect the carrot-fly in each of the games 40 levels. The player has to jump on lily pads and other platforms in order to avoid falling in the water, however they cannot control how far they jump. Instead, the ribbit rabbit alternates between jumping between 1 and 2 spaces, so the player must work around this limitation in order to complete each level.

sample_screenshots.caption: The fifth level has areas of land the player can safely move across.
It gives the player a basic tutorial.
Each world has 10 levels, for a total of 40 overall.
The game's levels are split up into 4 worlds.
The first level is very basic.

title: Ribbit Rabbit!

description: Sukima is an 80s style Japanese Action RPG where the player must rescue the kidnapped Princess Lemon. Like many games of this style, the player moves around the overworld walking up to enemies and attacking them with a sword. However the player also has a dodge button which they can use to avoid damage and open up bosses to attack. The players health can be regenerated by standing still in the overworld while not under attack. Defeating enemies will gain the player experience which can increase their attack and defence. The player can also increase their maximum health by finding fruit and gain abilities required to progress from statues.

sample_screenshots.caption: Collecting fruit increases the player's maximum health.
The player can now light up the cave around them.
After walking through the tunnel the player exits into the overworld.
Even more slimes to fight.
A fruit is hidden deep inside.

title: Sukima

description: Archery is a simple archery game where the player is given 10 arrows and most use them to score as many points as they can. The target moves up and down, with it's speed increasing with each successful hit. The player can move their bow up and down, as well as increase and decrease the power of their shot with the crank. Each successful hit scores the player 10 points.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game has no title screen, it just throws the player right in.
Once the player uses all their arrows it's game over and the player is given the choice of starting again.
The player has 10 arrows to use to score as many points as they can.
Each successful hit earns the player 10 points.
The player can use the crank to increase or decrease the power of their shot.

title: Archery

description: Chain Gun is a simple shooter game where the player uses a chain gun to shoot invaders flying in from the top of the screen. The player controls the chain gun by moving it left and right with the d-pad and turning the crank to shoot. As the game goes on the invaders become faster and more numerous. If one of the invaders reaches the bottom it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game starts with the basic instructions.
The chain gun fires when the player turns the crank.
"Invaders" fly in from the top of the screen.
If one of the invaders reaches the bottom then the game is over.
As the game goes on they become faster and more numerous.

title: Chain Gun

description: Flipper Lifter is a game where the player controls an elevator using the Playdate's crank. The player uses the elevator to pick up penguins and deliver them to their desired floor, scoring points and keeping the timer that's counting down at bay. The penguins are impatient and if the player takes to long they will leave. As the player scores points, additional floors are added to the building. When the timer reaches zero the game is over. If the player scores enough they unlock additional levels which feature new gimmicks, such as a dual elevator shaft in level 2.

sample_screenshots.caption: The goal is to pick up penguins and bring them to the floor they want to go.
Each new level introduces a new gimmick. Level 2 for example has two elevator shafts that the player can move between.
If the time reaches zero then the game is over.
As the players points increase, new floors are added.
The player can unlock additional levels by scoring enough in previous ones.

title: Flipper Lifter

description: Echoic Memory is a memory-based rhythm puzzle game that uses the Playdate's crank. The goal is to match pieces of music; each round, the player is played a sample of sound, and they must match it to one of several speakers. Players can use the Playdate's crank to tune a machine to try to bring the sound closer in line with the sample they heard. The story mode, in several chapters, follows a character who works on a factory line tuning new AI speakers.
title: Echoic Memory

description: In 1985, a high school student finds a mysterious old book underneath their brother's bed, each page filled with information on different demons. Like any high school student would, they decide to start summoning them to see what happens. This narrative simultation game has players summoning demons out of the Ars Goetia one at a time. Each summon requires the player to gather together a group of three friends, bring an appropriate offering, and play the correct music. Players can infer some of the information about what they need from the demon's profile in the Ars Goetia alongside friends' profiles in their yearbook; more information can be learned from other demons during conversations. The story branches based on what choices the player makes during negotiations.
title: Demon Quest '85

description: Sparrow Solitaire is a take on the classic game of mahjong solitaire, inspired by the gameplay and art of the original Mac Shanghai. The playfield features several layers of mahjong tiles; players must match two tiles of the same number and design together, but can only eliminate a tile if it's uncovered and if there's room to slide it out via the left and right sides. It features a number of different layouts, with multiple tilesets and backgrounds, and allows the use of the Playdate's crank to quickly move between tiles.
title: Sparrow Solitaire

description: Omaze is an abstract action-puzzle game based around circles. The player controls a small ball on the inside edge of a larger circle. Using the Playdate's crank, they can rotate their ball around the circle, and using the B button they can jump between circles at the points where they intersect, with the goal of hopping between circles until they reach the level's exit. As the game progresses, the player encounters many variations on the basic design: sometimes they're able to hop across the insides of circles using a dash; sometimes circles contain rotors that moves the player without the player needing to use the crank; sometimes there are obstacles that will defeat the player if touched.

sample_screenshots.caption: Title screen

title: Omaze

description: Hyper Meteor is a take on the classic arcade game Asteroids. As in the original game, players fly a spaceship on an endlessly-looping screen with the goal of eliminating asteroid obstacles. In this game, however, players don't have the ability to shoot - instead, they must ram directly into targets' weak spots. Each target is made up of both black and white regions, and they are vulnerable only in these white regions. Players turn the ship left and right using the Playdate's crank, use the B button to move forward, and use the A button to employ one of their limited set of screen-clearing bombs.
title: Hyper Meteor

description: Zipper is a tactics/puzzle game inspired by isometric games for early home computers like the ZX Spectrum and the MSX. The player controls a samurai invading a castle for revenge, meting it out one samurai at a time. Each turn, the player selects a number of tiles to move in one direction; the player character is able to "zip" to the target instantly, without waiting for his opponent's actions. Enemies can be slain if the player's movements cause him to run past an enemy's side, or to stop immediately in front of them. After the player's turn, the enemies all move simultaneously; if they're able to stop in front of the player character, they cut him down and the game must be start over from the beginning. Turning the Playdate's crank allows the player to preview enemy movements.
title: Zipper

description: Sasquatchers is a turn-based tactical game. The player controls a team of scientists traveling through forest areas, trying to set up photos and video of elusive cryptids and then switching to a first-person perspective to take the photos.
title: Sasquatchers

description:
Soko is a Playdate version of the classic Soko-Ban puzzle game. In each level, a number of boxes need to be moved to their target locations. The player can only push boxes to empty tiles, and can not move through walls. When stuck, players can use the Playdate's crank to quickly undo and redo moves. Levels get progressively more challenging, typically by increasing the amount of boxes on the board, and/or requiring more pushes to get each box to their target location.

Additional playable characters are unlocked as the player solves more levels, though these are merely cosmetic rewards and do not affect the gameplay itself.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level 6 of the Sokoflan set
Level 3 of the Sokoflan set
Soko title screen
Level selection menu

title: Soko

description:
Reel-istic Fishing is a 2D fishing game designed for the Playdate. Players take on the role of a legendary angler, looking for a new life in the Reel-istic Sea. On your way to the sea, your boat is struck by an unknown sea monster. Your new goal is to go deeper into the sea, and find that creature at any cost.

The gameplay is similar in style to Ridiculous Fishing, but with the twist that you can only catch a certain number of fish before your line snaps and you lose them all. Gameplay can quickly turn from hunting to avoiding. Once the fish are caught, you'll be harpooning them out of the sky, keeping the profits from whichever ones you can hit. Then you can take these profits to the local shopkeeper to purchase upgrades to take you deeper into the sea.
title: Reel-istic Fishing

description:
Down the Oubliette is a tower defense game where a girl plunges deeper and deeper into the haunted floors beneath a country house. Floors are randomized each run and the player must dig through dirt to uncover the spirit spawners, after which the ghosts will chase the player and the placed towers must be used to wear them down. The player can only see so much of the floor with the ambient light that follows them, but a radar helps them figure out which dirt may contain spirit spawners.

There are sixteen floors to a run with each thematic level consisting of four floors. Players can place four towers using the energy earned after clearing a wave of spirits, the beacon gradually wearing down ghosts with light, the coil zapping them with electricity, the fan holding them back a bit, and the torch emitting a stream of fire. Certain spirits are weak to specific tower types and towers can be upgraded to increase their effectiveness with crates found in certain stages.

The player can restart failed floors with impunity but will have to try again if they lose all of their character's hearts. Hearts replenish between floors and the tower-building energy is carried between them, and since players dig away the dirt to open up walkable areas, they can somewhat customize the path spirits will take when trying to reach their character.
title: Down the Oubliette

description: Dash Arena is an action game where you play as the hero and try to destroy all the slime monsters arriving around you. Time is running out and with each kill a little more time is added. Use the crank to find the direction for your attack, hit A and zip through the monsters around you to destroy them.
title: Dash Arena

description: YOYOZO is an action game where you use your space yoyo to collect stars with style. The game is played in fixed screen environment with a timer running.

sample_screenshots.caption: Credits
Easter egg emoji explosion
Controls
Gameplay
Score formula

title: YOYOZO

description: Swift Break is a Breakout clone created for the Playdate console using the Swift programming language. It was created as an example of how Swift's new embedded language mode could create a game for a highly-constrained platform such as the Playdate.
title: Swift Break

description:
Voidblazers is a casual shoot 'em up game for Playdate. The story follows Jyn and Echo, two space outlaws, who are captured by the Royal Order and consequently forced to assist in fighting off an alien fleet.

Players take direct control of Icarus – the spaceship that Jyn and Echo call their home – and battle 3 different fleets over the course of 25 missions. The main mechanics revolve around shooting down enemy ships while dodging incoming fire, with the occasional boss fight posing bigger challenges.

The story is told mostly through in-mission conversations between the crew. These conversations are partially randomised and affected by the items the player acquires from the shop that pops up in-between every couple of missions. This means that every playthrough is slightly different, and the player can influence how much / which conversations are shown.

After completing the main campaign, the player can start a New Game+. Starting a NG+ allows the player to keep all previously purchased items and upgrades, so that they can play through the missions again while unlocking more of the story. Additionally, a new Regal Run mode is unlocked, in which the player is challenged to survive all boss fights from the campaign in sequence, with a limited amount of lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: Player zig-zagging between Scavenger ships
Player being chased by a Royal Order boss ship
Player entering Boutique Cosmeau after a mission
Player engaging the Swarm fleet

title: Voidblazers

description:
Zero Zero: Perfect Stop is train driving game for Playdate which uses the Playdate's crank to control the train. It's a graphical showcase for the Playdate system, depicting a 3D environment with stylized 1-bit graphics.

The game is set in Yamanashi Prefecture, Japan, along the Fuji Express line. The setting is based on a real-world train line. Players act as the train driver, and must obey speed limits and achieve performance targets as they try to stop at each station as precisely as possible. The primary goals of the game are stopping the train on time according to the schedule, and stopping the train as closely to the target point as possible at each station.

It is an arcade style game that awards the player with a score and a rank at the end of each session. Scores are also sent to online leaderboards, so drivers can compete with other drivers worldwide.
title: Zero Zero: Perfect Stop

description: RocketBird Relaunched is an arcade score-chaser for the PlayDate. Using the crank, players try to dodge incoming obstacles as long as they can.
title: RocketBird Relaunched
Along Came a Spider: Valley of The Hollow
